meanings.definition: The quality or state of being characteristic of tweed fabric.
meanings.sent1: The tweedinesses of the jacket made it perfect for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent2: Her skirt had a touch of tweedinesses that gave it a classic look.
meanings.sent3: The tweedinesses of his hat clashed with the modern theme of the party.
meanings.sent4: The tweedinesses of the room enveloped me in a cozy embrace.
meanings.sent5: I could smell the earthy tweedinesses of the fabric as soon as I entered the shop.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being old-fashioned or traditional in style.
meanings.sent1: The tweedinesses of her dress reminded me of vintage fashion.
meanings.sent2: His tweedinesses in clothing always stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: She embraced the tweedinesses of the past with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: The tweedinesses of the antique shop transported me back in time.
meanings.sent5: The tweedinesses of the old clock added charm to the room.

meanings.definition: The feeling or appearance of being rough or coarse.
meanings.sent1: The tweedinesses of the carpet scratched my feet as I walked on it.
meanings.sent2: The tweedinesses of his hands showed the hard work he put in.
meanings.sent3: Despite its tweedinesses, the fabric was surprisingly soft to touch.
meanings.sent4: The tweedinesses of the wall gave the room a rustic feel.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the tweedinesses of the rope as I pulled it tight.
